api

Class TwitterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • api.TwitterManager

  • public class TwitterManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists of methods that use the Twitter API in order to get data. Can only be instantiated as a Singleton. This class is tightly coupled with FoursquareManager and is not expected to work without it.
    Author:
    Tudor-Daniel Sirbu, Claudiu Tarta, Florin-Cristian Gavrila

        public boolean userExists(long userId)

        Parameters:

      • query

        public java.util.List<twitter4j.Status> query(java.lang.String keywords,
                                     java.lang.String latitude,
                                     java.lang.String longitude,
                                     java.lang.String radius)
        Queries the Twitter API based on the combination of parameters it gets and returns 100 results for the keywords/hashtags provided.
        Parameters:
        keywords - keywords for the query
        latitude - latitude for the area where the search should be done
        longitude - longitude for the area where the search should be done
        radius - radius in kilometres for the area where the search should be done with the centre of the longitude and latitude provided
        Returns:

      • queryByLocation

        public java.util.HashSet<twitter4j.User> queryByLocation(java.lang.String locationName,
                                                java.lang.String locationLat,
                                                java.lang.String locationLong,
                                                java.lang.String days)
        Queries the Twitter API based on the combination of parameters it gets and returns 100 results if location name is provided. If both location name and coordinates are provided or only the coordinates are provided, it will return 10 results for each venue that it finds near the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        locationName - name of the location to be searched
        locationLat - latitude of the location
        locationLong - longitude of the location
        days - the number of days for the results to be provided
        Returns:
        a set of unique users that have checked in on Foursquare in the provided location

      • streamByLocation

        public void streamByLocation(java.lang.String locationName,
                    java.lang.String locationLat,
                    java.lang.String locationLong)
        Initializes the Twitter Streaming API for the search by location. If both location name and coordinates (latitude and longitude) are provided, the location name will be the only one take into consideration. If just one of the two is provided, then the results will be provided for it.
        Parameters:
        locationName - name of the location
        locationLat - latitude of the location
        locationLong - longitude of the location

      • findFoursquareUsers

        @Deprecated
public java.util.HashSet<twitter4j.User> findFoursquareUsers()
        Deprecated. 
        Method that searches for the tags "foursquare" and "#foursquare" and then returns a list of users that checked in on Foursquare from the results.
        Returns:
        a set of unique users that checked in on foursquare.

      • retweetsForStatus

        public java.util.List<twitter4j.Status> retweetsForStatus(java.lang.String statusId)
        Returns a list of statuses for a certain status, provided its id is given.
        Parameters:
        statusId - the id of the status for which retweets are wanted
        Returns:
        a list of statuses

      • getVenuesSince

        public java.util.ArrayList<fi.foyt.foursquare.api.entities.CompleteVenue> getVenuesSince(java.lang.Long userId,
                                                                                java.lang.Integer days)
        The method gets the venues that the user has visited in the last given days.
        Parameters:
        userId - the Twitter id of the user
        days - how many days in the past to look for visited venues
        Returns:
        a list of CompleteVenues and CompactVenues

      • extractURL

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> extractURL(twitter4j.Status status)
        The method extracts all URLs from a Status.
        Parameters:
        status - the status for which to get the URLs.
        Returns:
        a list of extracted URLs.

      • handleStatus

        public void handleStatus(twitter4j.Status status)
        Extracts the URLs in a status and then checks if there is a Foursquare in one of them, then adds it to the venues instance variable.
        Parameters:
        status - a status for which to check for Foursquare checkins.

      • handleNewStatusInStream

        public void handleNewStatusInStream(twitter4j.Status status)
        Used for the streaming functionality. Extracts the URLs in a status got from the Twitter Stream and checks for Foursquare checkins. If there are any present, it adds the user to the users instance variable.
        Parameters:
        status - a status for which to check for Foursquare checkins.
